pageContent.instructions: <welcomeText style=" font-family:Helvetica; font-size:11pt; line-height:18pt; text-align:justify; font-weight:bold; color:#333; display:block; margin:0 10px 10px">How will you summarize and conclude your meeting with Dr. Bennett?</welcomeText >

choice.choiceText: A. I will support you by leaving the materials and starters that you need.

B. Dr. Bennett, we have a good track record together. I will apply my knowledge and experience to help support the positive patient outcomes you’re looking for with Otsuka’s tools, education, and resources. These resources are designed to help you make informed prescribing decisions for your patients and to support your priorities.
C. Dr. Bennett, we have worked together for some time now, and Otsuka has proven we have products that work effectively for appropriate patient types.
D. Otsuka can help support positive patient outcomes by providing you with a product that is effective in treating appropriate patient types.

pageContent.summary: <welcomeText style=" font-family:Helvetica; font-size:12pt; line-height:18pt; text-align:justify; font-weight:normal; color:#333; display:block; margin:0 10px 10px">An effective personal value message should not focus on just the personal relationship you have with Dr. Bennett (Choice A), or just on the value Otsuka can provide (Choice D). By addressing just the personal relationship, you miss an opportunity to reinforce the value of Otsuka. At the same time, people buy from people, so it’s important to emphasize how you will partner with Dr. Bennett to help Sunnydale Psychiatry succeed. The best value message is one that ties back to the Value Map and includes both the value Otsuka has to offer and how you personally will specifically work with Sunnydale Psychiatry to achieve their practice priorities (Choice B).</welcomeText>
